It may be overkill, but we use HTTPUnit to test our HTML pages.  We
created a subclass of WebResponse that took our stringified HTML and
then did testing of WebTables, WebForms, TableCells, etc.

If you are already using HTTPUnit for other things like we are there is
no overhead.  If not, it may be worth it.

=jason

On Wed, 2003-03-26 at 14:45, Justin Thomas wrote: 

I have a program which generates two files, one an SVG file and the
other a
simple HTML page.

What is the best way to use JUnit to perform the tests?  

I don't really like the idea of doing file comparisons and would like
some
ideas on how to do this kind of testing

Thanks!
